text: The 2003-04 Austrian football Championship was organized by the Austrian Football Bundesliga. The First League served as the foundation for the Bundesliga. . The third performance level was represented by the regional leagues East (Vienna, Lower Austria, Burgenland), Middle (Upper Austria, Styria, Carinthia) and West (Salzburg, Tyrol, Vorarlberg). Grazer AK became champion for the first time. F.C. Wacker Innsbruck was promoted to the Bundesliga for the 2004-05 season. Josef Schicklgruber (SV Pasching) played all 36 matches in the league. ==Final table== Pl. Name M W D L P 1\. Grazer AK 36 21 9 6 72 2\. FK Austria Wien 36 21 8 7 71 3\. SV Pasching Name change on 21 July 2003 from SV Pasching to FC Pasching 36 17 12 7 63 4\. SK Rapid Wien 36 16 9 11 57 5\. SC Schwarz-Weiß Bregenz 36 11 12 13 45 6\. VfB Admira Wacker Mödling 36 11 9 16 42 7\. SV Austria Salzburg 36 11 5 20 38 8\. SV Mattersburg 36 9 10 17 37 9\. SK Sturm Graz 36 8 11 17 35 10\. 2-1 === Champion squad === (In bracketsːmatches and goals) Grazer AK * Goalkeeper: Franz Almer (3/-); Andreas Schranz (33/-) * Defenders: Anton Ehmann (27/3); Thomas Lechner (1/-); Mario Majstorović (6/-); Emanuel Pogatetz (31/1); Gregor Pötscher (30/-); Joachim Standfest (32/-); Mario Tokić (35/4) * Midfielders: Martin Amerhauser (28/2); René Aufhauser (28/5); Mario Bazina (33/7); Matthias Dollinger (28/1); Nikola Milinković (15/-); Samir Muratović (14/1); Dieter Ramusch (27/1); David Sencar (2/-); Gernot Sick (24/1); Libor Sionko (15/2) * Forwards: Michaël Goossens (13/-); Dominic Hassler (8/1); Roland Kollmann (32/27); Ilčo Naumoski (10/3); Skelley Adu Tutu (6/-) * Coach: Walter Schachner * Benedict Akwuegbu (9/3) und Enrico Kulovits (8/-) left the club during the season. champions == *Regional league Eastː SC-ESV Parndorf 1919 *Regional league Middleː FC Gratkorn *Regional league Westː SCR Altach Relegation matches :SCR Altach (against FC Lustenau) and FC Gratkorn (against SC-ESV Parndorf 1919) were promoted to the 2nd league. ==References== ==References == Category:Football in Austria Category:Football seasons
